tool.name: Ensemble_Masker

param.name: in_ensemble_nc
param.dialogReference: A ensemble model NetCDF generated prior using the Ensemble Model tool. Requires x, y, dimensions belief, disbelief, plausibility and interval variables.

param.name: out_nc
param.dialogReference: The folder location and filename of the output NetCDF file containing the masked ensemble model output.

param.name: in_mask_file
param.displayname: Input mask NetCDF or GeoTiff file
param.dialogReference: A NetCDF or GeoTiff file that covers the extent of the input ensemble model NetCDF file. Values within a specified variable will be used to mask out areas of the underlying ensemble model.

param.name: in_var
param.dialogReference: The variable within the provided mask NetCDF or GeoTiff to use as the mask layer.

param.name: in_type
param.dialogReference:
The single (binary) or range of values that will used to set all underlying ensemble pixels to NoData. Options include:

- Binary: set a single, specific pixel value within the mask input to act as the mask area

- Range: set a range of values value within the mask input to act as the mask area

param.name: in_binary
param.dialogReference:
A single, specific pixel value within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has mine infrastructure represented as a value of 3, set this to 3 to mask out infrastructure in the ensemble input.

param.name: in_range_min
param.dialogReference:
The minimum value within a range of values embedded within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has undesirable vegetation heights between 0m to 2m, set the minimum to 0 and the maximum to 2 to mask these areas out of the ensemble input.

param.name: in_range_max
param.dialogReference:
The maximum value within a range of values embedded within the mask input to act as the mask area.

For example, if the mask input file has undesirable vegetation heights between 0m to 2m, set the minimum to 0 and the maximum to 2 to mask these areas out of the ensemble input.

param.name: in_replace
param.dialogReference: Replace the masked areas with this value.

param.name: in_add_result_to_map
param.dialogReference: Whether to visualise the results to the currently active map once modelling is complete or not.

tool.summary:
Use an existing NetCDF or GeoTiff file to mask out undesired areas of the output from the ensemble model.

This tool is useful for remove infrastructure or certain vegetation heights (if a canopy height model is available) from the model.

dataIdInfo.idCredit: Lewis Trotter, Todd Robinson, Curtin University, FrontierSI, Digital Earth Australia, Geoscience Australia
